title: ICE(async_await,futures_api,await_macro,generators): cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(1), BrAnon(2)) <= '_#1r

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Polish
labels.description: Async-await issues that are part of the "polish" area

body:
I tried to write a generic `async` wrapper for something similar to `tokio_reactor::PollEvented` that calls `poll_...`, `clear_...` and `yield` depending on the `io::Result` of an operation and got the error mentioned in the subject.

I managed to reduce the code triggering it to this:

```rust
#![feature(async_await,futures_api,await_macro,generators)]

pub struct Foo;

impl Foo {
	async fn with<'a, F, R>(&'a self, f: F) -> R
	where
		F: Fn() -> R + 'a,
	{
		loop {
			match f() {
				_ => yield,
			}
		}
	}

	pub async fn run<'a>(&'a self, data: &'a [u8])
	{
		await!(self.with(move || {
			println!("{:p}", data);
		}))
	}
}

fn main() {
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=b33785b77fd4d07e973d95a7068f16b6))

Probably related to #53989.

Full error message:

